alert.note: Alert for Marathon (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 24 at 11:53PM CDT until October 27 at 12:00PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Green Bay WI has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Big Eau Pleine River near Stratford affecting Marathon County. .Several rounds of heavy rain had produced 2 to 4 inches of rain across central Wisconsin on Tuesday. Rainfall is expected to diminish late tonight and end on Wednesday. Another round of heavy rain is forecast Wednesday night into Thursday night, with another 1 to 2 inches possible. This amount of precipitation would keep the river above flood stage into at least Friday. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...No flooding is currently forecast. * WHERE...Big Eau Pleine River near Stratford. * WHEN...From this evening to early Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, There is widespread lowland flooding. The river current is strong. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 14.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 11.0 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 15.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 1100 am CDT.Wednesday morning.
